#Text=Wikinews interviews Mike Lebowitz , chairman of the U.S. Modern Whig Party
#Text=Friday , July 17 , 2009

#Text=According to the Pew Research Center , a non-advocacy organization that evaluates issues , attitudes and trends shaping the political landscape of the United States , centrism is on the rise in America .
#Text=According to Pew , the number of Americans identifying themselves as independents has reached the highest level in 70 years .
#Text=Recently 36 % of Americans say they are independents , 35 % identify as Democrats , while 23 % see themselves as Republicans .
#Text=Some people are abandoning the major parties , re-registering as independent or joining third parties .
#Text=One of these third parties are the Modern Whig Party ( MWP ) , who have enjoyed phenomenal growth over the past year ; from just 3,000 members last summer to 30,000 now .
#Text=With the Party 's commitment to " fiscal responsibility " and " bold social progression " , several conservative Democrats and centrist Republicans have been attracted to it .

column1: #Text=He went on to say much more — including why he thinks you should consider leaving the GOP or the Dems for the MWP — in the interview below .
#Text=Interview
#Text=In a nutshell , what does the Modern Whig Party stand for ?
#Text=Founded by Iraq and Afghanistan veterans , the Modern Whig Party represents a movement toward common sense , rational solutions ahead of partisan bickering and ideology .
#Text=Is the MWP on the left or right end of the political spectrum ?
#Text=The general principles of the Modern Whig Party relate to fiscal responsibility , strong national defense and bold social progression .

#Text=Looking a bit deeper into our detailed vision , the organization takes pragmatic , realistic , and mainstream approaches to areas such as energy independence and tax disbursement that take into account the needs of corporate America along with everybody else .
#Text=To this end , our membership is comprised of people from all parts of the mainstream political spectrum .
#Text=This tells us that we may be on the right track for developing that elusive formula where voters of all political stripes can find common ground with one political movement .
#Text=How old is your party ?
#Text=Who founded it and why ?
#Text=The historic Whig Party was a dominant political force that included such luminaries as Abraham Lincoln .
#Text=So in that regard , the Whigs are one of the oldest political movements in the nation .
#Text=The modern revival was conceived by American soldiers serving in Iraq , who in turn communicated via the Internet such ideas with fellow soldiers in Afghanistan .
#Text=In Iraq and Afghanistan , soldiers have a lot of time to reflect .
#Text=We watched how common sense rationality was being abandoned in favor of partisan bickering and decisions based solely on ideology .
#Text=We noticed how the partisan fighting and ideological focus trumped common sense on not just military issues , but most other issues as well .
#Text=This included traffic , education , trade , scientific development , fiscal soundness , energy independence , etc.
#Text=Upon our return in 2006 , we initially revived the Whig Party as a military advocacy organization on behalf of soldiers , veterans and military families .
#Text=By 2008 , we had attracted a group of military and non-military supporters to the point where we became a mainstream political organization .
#Text=The historic Whigs represented a moderate , common sense movement focused on improving US infrastructure and education .
#Text=In this regard , we found the Whigs to be an excellent fit in our modern context .
